titles.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 1993) to reauthorize the Overseas Private Investment Corporation and the Trade and Development Agency, and for other purposes.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 106-376, by Mr. Diaz-Balart.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 1993 with 1 hour of general debate. Previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions except motion to recommit with or without instructions. Makes in order the Committee on International Relations amendment in the nature of a substitute now printed in the bill. Measure will be read by section. Bill is open to amendments. No amendment shall be in order excpet those pre-printed in the Congressional Record.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 128.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 327.
The previous question was ordered without objection.

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 10/12/1999--Introduced. Sets forth the rule (modified open) for the consideration of H.R. 1993 (Overseas Private Investment Corporation and the Trade and Development Agency reauthorization).
